Title: Inorganic Chemistry I
Description: Covers the principal models of inorganic chemistry: structure and bonding, interactions in the solid state, coordination compounds, complexation equilibria, and acid-base models.

Title: Inorganic Chemistry II
Description: Covers group theory in inorganic chemistry, including crystal field descriptions of transition metal chemistry and qualitative molecular orbital approach to and spectroscopic methods for inorganic molecules.

Title: Inorganic Chemistry III
Description: Covers constitutions and properties of organometallic compounds, including carbonyls and nitrosyls. Also covers kinetic properties of mononuclear and biometallic centers. Includes computer modeling/display of inorganic structures.

Title: Analytical Chemistry I
Description: Covers principles and techniques of optical methods of analysis.

Title: Analytical Chemistry II
Description: Covers physical and chemical methods of separation, including distillation, solvent extraction, and chromatographic and ion-exchange techniques.

Title: Organic Chemistry I
Description: Covers spectroscopic methods for the determination of the structure of organic molecules.

Title: Organic Chemistry II
Description: Covers static and dynamic stereochemistry; conformational theory; relationships between structure and reactivity in organic reactions; and applications to asymmetric synthesis, physical measurements, and biochemical mechanisms.

Title: Organic Chemistry III
Description: Covers mechanisms of organic reactions and the techniques of studying them.

Title: Chemical Kinetics
Description: Focuses on experimental and theoretical consideration of chemical reaction rates.

Title: Quantum Chemistry Of Molecules I
Description: Covers general properties of operators; Schrodinger's equation and its solutions for a particle in a box; harmonic oscillator, tunneling problems, rigid rotor, and the hydrogen atom; approximation methods; and absorption of radiation and selection rules.

Title: Physical Chemistry I
Description: Schrodinger's equation and particle-wave duality, atomic structure and spectra, optical spectroscopy on molecules (rotational, vibrational and electronic spectra) molecular symmetry, design of modern spectrometers, magnetic resonance spectroscopy.

Title: Physical Chemistry II
Description: Covers statistical mechanics of distinguishable and indistinguishable particle systems, and thermodynamic functions for both systems and chemical equilibrium.

Title: Polymer Chemistry I
Description: Covers step growth, polymerization (including polyesters, polycarbonate, nylon, epoxies, urethanes, and formaldehyde-based polymers), step growth kinetics, molecular weight distributions, infinite networks and gelation, techniques of polymerization, ring opening polymerization, thermodynamics of polymer solutions, biological polymers, inorganic polymers, biomedical applications, and electrically conducting polymers.

Title: Polymer Chemistry II
Description: Includes chain growth polymerization (free radical, ionic, coordination, group-transfer, radiation-induced, and electrochemical polymerizations), kinetics of chain growth polymerization, molecular weight distributions, polymerization/depolymerization equilibria, techniques of polymerization, kinetics of polymerization, reactions of polymers, degradation of polymers, chain conformation and configuration, rubber elasticity, and copolymerization.

Title: Polymer Chemistry III
Description: Covers polymer characterization and analysis; morphology; molecular weight determination, including end group analysis, and colligative properties (vapor pressure lowering, ebulliometry, cryoscopy, osmometry); light scattering; viscosity; gel permeation chromatography; sedimentation; diffusion and permeation; polymer identification; plasticizers; x-ray diffraction; thermal behavior; and spectroscopic techniques.
Prerequisites: CHEM 561 [Min Grade: B] or CHEM 562 [Min Grade: B]

Title: Chemistry of Biomolecules
Description: This course is a chemistry-based approach to understanding the basic structure, chemical reactivity, and biological function of biomolecules – including amino acids, peptides, proteins, carbohydrates, nucleic acids, and lipids. A special emphasis will be given to topics in the frontiers of biomolecular research at the interface between chemistry and biology.

Title: Quantum Chemistry of Molecules II
Description: ContinuesCHEM 555. Covers matrix theory and group theory, atomic structures, and self-consistent field methods including the Hartree-Fock theory. Introduces theory of chemical bonding.

Title: Physical Chemistry III
Description: Covers interaction of molecules with electromagnetic radiation, including internal quantum states and structure of atoms and simple molecules, applications of atomic and molecular spectroscopy, and lasers in chemistry.

Title: Biophysical Chemistry
Description: Thermodynamics and kinetics to aqueous biological systems. Properties and behavior of biological macromolecules.

Title: Chemical Instrumentation
Description: Provides hands-on training in the use of various spectroscopic (FT-IR, UV/VIS, fluorescence, AA), chromatographic (packed and capillary column GC, HPLC), and electrochemical (potentiometry, coulometry, polarography) techniques. Involves lectures with self-paced laboratory work.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Mass Spectrometry
Description: Covers basic interpretive skills for organic and biochemical analysis; basic ion optics design using SIMON; survey of ionization methods, ion selection or separation techniques, and detectors; and applications in chemistry and biology.

Title: Chemical Information Retrieval
Description: Examines methods for retrieving literature information, via standard tabulations, journals, and abstracts, using hard-copy and electronic sources. Includes techniques for online searching of databases such as Chemical Abstracts, Beilstein, and crystallographic depositories.

Title: Organometallic Chemistry
Description: Covers compounds with metal-carbon bonds, including molecular and electronic structures and bonding descriptions, constitutions, reactivities, and syntheses of main-group and transition metal carbonyl, alkene, alkyne, alkyl, and arene complexes and clusters.

Title: The Solid State
Description: Covers types of bonding in solids, lattice specific heat, phonons, thermal conductivity, free electron gas, band theory of metals and semiconductors, intrinsic and extrinsic semiconductivity, and magnetic properties and superconductivity.

Title: Electronics for Chemical Instrumentation
Description: Covers digital electronics for chemical instrumentation, including Boolean algebra and its applications to digital circuits, implementation of basic Boolean operations with solid-state devices, and applications of digital circuits to chemical instrumentation.

Title: Electronics for Chemical Instrumentation ll
Description: Instrument components such as temperature, pressure, and light radiance controllers, etc. will be designed in the lectures and built and tested in the laboratory on the test board built by the student. It contains regulated +15, -15 and 5 regulated power supplies. Same sided wire wrap sockets allow amplifiers and other circuit elements to be easily and reliably mounted and connected. The test board belongs to the student.

Title: Experimental Design and Statistics in Chemistry
Description: Covers descriptive statistics; single and multiple linear regression techniques for analytical calibration; analysis of variance methods; basic experimental design, including full and fractional factorial techniques; and experimental optimization using steepest ascent and simplex techniques.

Title: Advanced Organic Synthesis I
Description: Covers organic functional group transformation and manipulation. Includes oxidations, reductions, additions to pi bonds, substitution reactions including aromatic substitutions, and reactions of electron-deficient intermediates.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Topics in Inorganic Chemistry
Description: Covers specialized principles of inorganic chemistry plus contemporary advances in the field. May be repeated for credit when topics vary.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Chemistry Research Seminar
Description: Provides presentation and discussion of current research topics in chemistry.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Topics in Polymer Chemistry
Description: Covers fundamental concepts in conductivity, magnetism and optical properties, or organic and polymeric materials; elements of the organic solid state; chemical and electrochemical synthesis; structure characterization; and properties and applications of these polymers.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Topics in Analytical Chemistry
Description: Surveys new or developing instrumental or chemical analysis techniques. Covers spectroscopic, chromatographic, and/or electrochemical techniques for analysis of solutions or surfaces.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Master's Thesis
Description: M.S. thesis.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Research
Description: Requires students to select a topic for investigation and obtain the approval of the staff member in charge of the project. The hours and credits are determined for each individual.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Ph.D. Dissertation
Description: Ph.D. dissertation.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Title: Independent Study in CHEM
Description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

Description: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
